children.text: The Book of Proverbs
Proverbs
Pro
Proverbs
These are the sayings that compare one example with another, to teach moral lessons and to make people wise, from Solomon the king of Israel, who was son of David.
The purpose of these sayings is to teach the meaning of wisdom
and give examples of moral instruction, so wise teaching can guide you.
These sayings offer correction so you may live by wisdom,
by the measures of what is right, what is just, and what is fair.
They give wise teaching to those who have no experience and to instruct those who do not know how to live a moral life,
and to give the young the knowledge they need and to teach them the understanding they do not have—
so the wise may listen to these sayings and increase in their learning,
and those who already have insight will gain more ways to live according to the lessons of wisdom.
They seek to understand the lessons of the proverbs and the meaning of the parables.
These are the words of the wise and their difficult riddles.
You must begin your search for knowledge by honoring Yahweh and respecting him,
a fool who dishonors himself hates wisdom and fights against the one who corrects him.
My son, listen when your father teaches you
and do not disobey the rules your mother set down.
Their teaching is a wreath upon your head,
and beautiful necklaces around your neck,
they are priceless gifts from your parents.
My son, as sinners try to draw you into their sin with smooth talk and flattery,
do not listen to what they say and do not follow them.
They may say, "Come with us! Join us!
We will hide in wait and we will take the life of one who passes by.
We will hide ourselves and we will rise up and attack a person who has done us no wrong—that will be our sport.
Like the grave has power to take even a healthy person and drag them to the place of the dead, we will take their life from them.
We will make them like those who fall into the place where there is no hope of escape.
We will find many valuable and expensive items,
and we will fill our houses with what we stole from them!
So, come, be part of our team!
We will split into equal shares, and give to each member of our team, from all the things we stole."
My son, do not walk that road with them!
Do not put your foot down on the same path on which they walk!
They run to the places where they do terrible things,
They hurry so they can commit murder.
It is useless to put out a net to trap a bird
while the bird is watching you.
These men make plans that turn around and kill them.
They set a trap and the trap catches them.
These are the ways of all who gain their riches through theft and deceit;
the things they stole destroy the lives of the thieves who cling to them.
Wisdom is like a woman who cries out in the streets.
Wisdom calls out to people in the plazas.
At the intersection of busy streets she cries out
and at the entrance of city gates.
She cries, "How long will you who have not been taught, will you love being enticed to do what will harm you?
How long will you who think you know more than the wise, have so much joy in the little you know?
How long will you fools refuse to learn?
If you pay attention to me when I correct you,
I will tell you all I am thinking.
I will help you understand what I am saying to you.
But when I called to you, you refused to listen.
I beckoned you and stretched out my hands to you,
but no one paid any attention.
You refused to listen to my advice
and you did not listen when I corrected you.
I will laugh at you, when you are experiencing troubles,
when you are terribly afraid,
I will have contempt for you and not compassion.
When troubles strike you like a powerful storm,
and disasters hit you like a violent wind,
when you experience distress and you go through difficulties,
I will have contempt for you.
When people call to me to help them,
but I will not answer them.
They will be desperate for my help, and search everywhere for me,
but they will not find me.
They reject what I say and they hate what I know,
and they made a choice not to show respect to Yahweh.
They would not obey what I told them to do,
and they did not pay attention when I tried to correct them.
So they will experience the consequences of their actions
when they carry out their evil plans.
Those who have not been taught wisdom are foolish.
Fools choose to make no decision about anything, but be sure of this: Their failure to make a decision will destroy their lives.
But those who pay attention to me will live in peace and safety,
and they will rest and not be afraid of any disaster that may come."
My son, listen to what I say,
and consider my commands to be as valuable as a treasure.
Pay attention to wisdom
and try hard to understand what is wise.
Call out to Yahweh to get insight,
plead with him to help you understand more of what he wants you to know.
Search eagerly for wisdom, like you would search for silver—
like you would search for a treasure that someone has hidden.
If you do that, you will understand how to give Yahweh the respect he deserves,
and you will succeed in knowing God.
Yahweh is the one who gives us wisdom.
He is the one who tells us things that we need to know and understand.
He stores up good advice so he can give it to them who honor him by the way they live their lives.
He protects those who do with their lives what they say with their lips.
He guards justice and works to see it is done,
and he keeps safe those who are faithful to him.
You will understand what Yahweh sees is right and what Yahweh determines is just to do,
and he will show you the best way to live.
Wisdom will fill your life;
knowing what Yahweh wants you to know will cause you to be joyful.
You will learn to tell the difference between right and wrong
and that will keep you safe.
You will not do what Yahweh forbids you to do,
and you will stay away from those who imagine horrible things and talk about them.
They go the wrong way,
and they walk where there is no light.
They are glad when they do what is wrong,
they twist good things into bad and enjoy doing what they know is wrong.
They bend the truth and live by deception
and their lies hide what they have done.
Wisdom will keep you safe from the adulterous woman,
and you will not pay attention when a strange woman invites you to be with her.
Those women left the husbands they married when they were young,
they forgot the promise they made to God to love only the one they married.
Those who enter her house are taken to their death,
because the way to her house takes them where dead people are buried.
All who go to her to sleep with her have no way to get out of her house,
they will be so lost they will never find the way back to life.
You must live your life in the same way that good men are living.
You should do the same things as those who do what is right.
Those who do what is right will receive the land as a gift from Yahweh,
and only those who do what they have promised will stay in the land for a long time.
Those who do bad things will have no claim to this land,
and people who take advantage of others and do not keep their word, they will never have even a small part of the land.
My son, do not forget the lessons I have taught you.
Keep my commands inside of you, as important guidance for how you will live,
because they will help you live a long life, measured in either days or years,
and they will bring you peace in addition to all the lessons they teach you.
Treat others with tenderness and always speak the truth to them.
Let tenderness and truth guide you in every relationship,
as if they both were on a necklace you wear, a necklace that guides you in everything you say.
Then you will experience God's delight in you,
and people will also approve of you.
Put all your trust in Yahweh,
and do not take action because you made up your mind what you should do;
but in every choice and decision, look to Yahweh,
and he will show you how you must live.
Do not think you are wise enough to direct your life,
give Yahweh the reverence he deserves,
and when evil invites you in, turn aside from it.
Giving Yahweh reverence will make your body healthy
and it will give your bones the food it needs.
When you gain money, honor Yahweh by giving him the tithe;
give him the first portion of what you received, to remember it all came from him.
If you honor Yahweh,
and your barrels will be bursting with all the wine you have made.
My son, do not hate it when Yahweh corrects you,
and when he rebukes you, do not resent it,
for Yahweh only corrects those he loves,
just like parents correct their children whom they love.
Those who get wisdom are fortunate;
with her they also get understanding.
Wisdom gives you a better profit than owning silver,
and she will give you something that is much more valuable than gold.
Being wise is more precious than jewels
and there is nothing you desire that is worth as much as wisdom.
Wisdom can make you able to live a long life, if you do what she teaches;
she is also ready to make you wealthy and to persuade other people to honor you.
Wisdom is known by how kind she is,
and she always directs you to the place where you will find peace.
Wisdom is like a tree whose fruit gives life to those who hold on to it,
and Yahweh gives happiness to those who hold on to it.
By his wisdom Yahweh laid out the earth from the very beginning,
and by his understanding he put everything in the heavens exactly where they should be.
The deepest part of the oceans broke open according to Yahweh's design,
and in the same way, he made the dew so it would fall from the clouds above.
My son, hold on to good sense in the decisions you make,
and do not take your eye off of them.
They will bring life to you,
and a sign of Yahweh's blessings on your life
that people can see by your good judgment.
Your good decisions will take you where you are going in safety,
and they will keep you from taking a wrong step on the way.
When you lie down to sleep, you will not have any fear,
and your sleep will be refreshing.
Do not let a disaster fill you with terror,
and do not let the wicked fill you with fear when they come for you.
Yahweh takes your side to defend you,
he will not allow any trap to catch and hold you.
Give good gifts to those who deserve it,
when you can, help them.
Do not say to your neighbor, "Come back later;
perhaps I will help you tomorrow,"
when you have the money with you and can help them now.
Do not make plans to harm anyone you know,
especially those who live close to you and trust you.
If a person has done nothing to you,
do not argue with him or say he has done something to you, when he has not.
Do not envy a person who does violence to others,
and do not imitate anything he does.
A lying person is hated by Yahweh for what he does,
but Yahweh is a close friend to anyone who lives rightly.
Yahweh promises punishment to the families of those who do evil things.
but he makes happy the families of the good.
Yahweh makes fools of those who treat others with disrespect,
but he gives his kindness to people who are humble.
Those who are wise will be honored,
but foolish people will become well known for their dishonor.
Listen, children, listen to what I am teaching you.
If you pay attention, you will learn about what it means to understand.
The lessons I give to you are good teaching, given in order.
So do not refuse to learn the lessons I teach you.
When I was my father's boy,
and the only child of my mother,
my father told me, "Put my words deep within you,
obey my orders to you,
and you will have life.
Hold on to what is wise and whatever helps you understand,
and do not forget the lessons I taught you and do not throw away the insights I spoke to you.
Do not run away from the lessons which the wise teach you,
because if you become wise, wisdom will keep you safe.
Love wisdom and it will guard your life.
The most important thing you can do is to study the principles of wisdom
and spend all you own so you can grow more and more in your understanding.
Wisdom is to be loved more than anything that is valuable, and she will raise you to a high position—
and wisdom will honor you when you show how much you love it.
When you have attained wisdom, it will be like a beautiful wreath of honor on your head;
she will give you a beautiful crown."
Hear, my son, listen and understand what I say to you—
do this, and you will live a long life.
I directed you in the way you should walk and to use the wisdom you were taught;
I led you by the hand down the roads, roads that are the right way for you to go.
When you live, you do not have anyone to blame; if you live wisely,
when you use all your effort, you will succeed .
Remember the lessons that discipline taught you,
and do not let them go.
Guard them; for you live your life by them.
Do not do what wicked people do, nor be with them;
do not be with people who do evil things.
Stay far from those ways;
turn another way and go on another road.
Evil people cannot rest until they have done something that Yahweh said they must not do.
They will not rest until they force someone to fall, someone who was doing well until they came along.
They get their strength, and they are fed by doing what is wrong;
and they are intoxicated by hurting others; they get drunk on it.
The path taken by those who do right grows brighter and brigher, like the rising of the sun at dawn,
and it shines brighter and brighter until it is as full as the light of day.
The actions of the wicked are like the darkness—
they stumble because they cannot see what makes them fall.
My son, pay attention to what I am saying to you.
Pay attention to these lessons I am teaching you.
Keep reading them over and over,
and keep them deep within you.
For my words bring a message of life to those who pay attention to them,
and their message brings health to the entire body.
Protect your heart with all your strength and guard what you love;
guard it, for it becomes a fountain overflowing with life.
Make it your aim to keep away from you any lying speech,
and put any deceptive talk far away.
Look straight ahead because you are focused on what is good and right,
and do not turn aside to the right or to the left.
Take care about where you will go, and take care to be sure that the way is safe;
then you will know what to expect along the way.
Do not leave the straight road by turning to the left or to the right,
and do not follow the way that leads to evil.
My son, learn the lessons I teach you about wisdom.
I understand much about this, so listen very carefully to what I tell you.
If you do that, you will learn the difference between what is important and what is not,
and you will not mix true knowledge with mistakes when you speak.
The woman who desires to commit adultery speaks with words that are sweet,
and her kisses are smoother than oil,
but in the end, she is so bitter you can taste it,
and she cuts you like a sharp sword.
She walks down to the place of death;
if you follow her, she will lead you all the way to the grave.
She does not want to take the path that will let her live for a long time.
She goes here and there, but where she is going she does not know.
So now, my sons, pay attention to what I say,
and do not forget or disobey the instruction I am giving you.
Stay far away from the immoral woman;
do not go near the door of her house.
If you go to her you will lose the respect of others,
and you give your life to someone who will not have mercy on you.
It may be that others will take all the wealth that you have earned,
and it goes into the houses of people you do not know.
And when you are about to die,
you will groan because your flesh and your body are wasting away.
Then you will say, "I hated it when I was punished for doing wrong;
I despised people when they told me how to live.
I did not obey my teachers
and I paid no attention to those who taught me.
I was almost destroyed by bad things that happened to me;
and this was known to everyone who came together to worship Yahweh."
Just as you drink water from your own cistern, be faithful to your own wife.
You would not waste your own water by pouring it into the street,
or let your water run into the public places.
Let both your water and your wife be for you alone to enjoy,
and not for others to share with you.
May your fountain be blessed;
may you be happy with the woman you married when you were young.
She is as graceful as a loving deer and as graceful as a young doe.
Let her breasts always satisfy your longings,
so you are forever enraptured with her love.
My son, why should you be caught up in the arms of an adulteress?
Why should you caress the breasts of another man's wife?
Yahweh sees everything we do; nothing is hidden from him.
He sees every path we take; he knows everywhere we go.
An evil person's sinful desires take hold of him;
his sins are like a trap that catches him.
An evil man will die because he could not say, "No" to his desires;
he gets lost because his foolishness has no limits.
My son, if you provide a guarantee for a neighbor who takes out a loan,
or if you give the promise that you will pay for a loan of a person you do not know,
you laid a trap for yourself by making the promise,
and you have been caught by agreeing to a contract for someone you did not know.
Do this, my son, and deliver yourself from this difficulty:
humbly go to your neighbor and beg him to cancel the agreement that you made.
Do not sleep,
and do not rest until you go and talk with him.
Save yourself,
like a deer that escapes from the hunter;
or like a bird that flies away from the hand of one who hunts for birds.
You lazy person, learn something from watching the ants.
Become wise and watch what they do.
The ant has no commander, officer, or ruler telling him what to do,
but during the summer it works hard,
gathering and storing food to eat during the winter.
But you lazy person, how long will you continue to sleep ?
When will you rise and go to work?
You sleep a for a little time, and then you say, "A little more sleep, a little more resting in bed,
a little more folding of the hands to take a nap."
Suddenly poverty will take over your life like a thief who steals everything from you.
A worthless person — a person who does bad to others—he lives by the lies he speaks to others.
They tell tales by winking their eyes and they give signals by moving their feet, and they make plans by pointing with their fingers.
The one who does bad things lays out plans within himself;
he stirs up constant conflict wherever he goes.
His own disaster will overtake him in a second;
he will be crushed to the point that he cannot be healed.
There are six, even seven, things that Yahweh hates.
Yahweh hates the eyes of the proud, the tongue that tells lies,
the hands that shed the blood of the innocent,
a heart that plots and makes plans to do evil things to others,
the witness who breathes out lies when he gives testimony,
and the one who causes strife between members of the same family.
My son, obey the command of your father,
and do not walk away from what your mother taught you.
Keep these lessons and tie them close inside as a part of yourself;
tie them around your neck, to remind you how important they are to you.
When you walk, those lessons will guide you.
When you sleep, they will watch over you and protect you.
When you wake up in the morning, they will teach you.
These commands are like a lamp for you, and what we teach you is like a light to guide you.
When people correct you, this is to continually teach you the right way to live.
These lessons keep you from the immoral woman,
they tell you about her enticing words and warn you to be on guard.
Do not throw your desires after such a woman, nor should you desire her beauty;
do not let her capture you by the way she looks at you.
Sleeping with a prostitute may cost you only the price of a loaf of bread,
but if you sleep with another man's wife, it may cost you your life.
Can you carry hot coals in your pockets and not be burned?
Can you walk on burning coals and not scorch your feet?
So is anyone who sleeps with another man's wife—he will suffer for doing that.
It is certain he will be severely punished.
We do not despise a thief if he steals some food because he is very hungry.
But if he steals something and then is caught by others,
he will have to pay back seven times as much as he stole,
even if he must sell everything that is in his house to get enough money to repay what he stole.
But a man who commits adultery is has no good judgment
because he is destroying his own self.
Wounds and shame will come to him;
he will never forget how others disgraced him for his deed.
Because that woman's husband will be jealous, he will become furious,
and when he gets revenge, he will not act mercifully toward that man.
And he will not accept any bribe to stop him.
My son, obey the words I say to you;
remember all my orders.
If you obey my commands, you will live.
Consider my commands to be the most precious thing you possess, and obey them.
Write down my commands and tie them to your fingers to remind youreself of them;
let it be as if you had written them in your inner self.
Think of wisdom as if it were a woman, one of your own sisters, whom you love;
think of understanding as if it were a person, one of your own family, to whom you are loyal.
If you do this, you will be able to stay away from women whom you must not be with,
random women who say nice things to you so that you will sin with them.
Standing in my house, I looked out of a window,
through the wooden shade,
and I saw some young men who had not yet learned how to live wisely.
I especially saw a young man there who had no good judgment.
He walked down the street near the house on the corner of the road,
and he walked toward the house of the adultress.
It was the time of day when night and darkness were coming near.
That was where the woman who was seeking an affair met the young man, and she greeted him.
She was dressed as prostitutes dress, with seductive and enticing clothes, and she had secret plans.
She was loud and wayward, attracting attention.
She did not stay in her own home.
She searched for a man as she walked along the streets one day; on another day she stood in the market place to find a man.
At any street corner she waited for someone who would commit sin with her.
When she saw the young man, she firmly took hold of him, and then she kissed him.
Without any shame and with great boldness, she said,
"Today I have meat in my house, because I made a sacrifice in the temple to promise friendship with Yahweh.
In this way I kept my vows to Yahweh,
and now I have come out here to meet you.
I was looking for you, and now I have found you!
I have put on my bed sheets—the finest colored linen fabrics from Egypt.
I have sprinkled perfumes on my bed—
myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Come! Let us make love all night, until the morning comes.
Let us enjoy ourselves with many ways of making love, as much as we want.
My husband is not at home;
he has gone away on a long journey.
He filled a bag with money and took it with him;
he will not come back until the middle of the month."
So she she convinced the young man with her persuasive words;
because of her smooth and convincing talk, he gave in to what she wanted to do.
He suddenly decided to follow her inside.
He followed her like an ox going to the place where its owner will slaughter it,
or like a deer
caught in a trap, where the hunter kills it by shooting an arrow into its inner parts.
He was like a bird that flies into a trap
without knowing that it will die there.
My sons, listen to me,
and pay careful attention to what I say to you.
You must resist her from within you, from deep inside. Do not decide to do what you want and follow her.
You must decide that you will never follow her where she goes.
She has caused many men to be ruined;
truly, no one can count the men she destroyed—they are too many to count.
The road to her house is the road to the grave;
it goes down to the place where the dead are kept.
Listen to Wisdom calling; her voice sounds like that of a woman who shouting in the public square.
Understanding raises her voice; she sounds like a woman who calls out to be heard.
On the top of the hills and where the roads come together,
there Wisdom stands.
Wisdom also stands at the gates at the entrance to the city, and she calls out with a loud voice. Wisdom says:
"I am calling out to everyone;
I am shouting to all people!
You people who have no training, you must be taught how to live;
you must learn so that you can understand completely.
Listen to me, because I will explain to you some excellent things.
I can teach you about what is right—
for I speak what is true;
I detest evil things so much, I hate to even speak about them.
Everything that I say is right;
I do not say anything that changes the meaning of what is good or that leads people away from it.
My words give good advice to the one who understands the meaning of what I say;
those who have learned to tell good from evil will easily know that my words are right.
Choose what I teach you,
instead of trying to get much silver;
and choose the knowledge I will show you, for it is more valuable than gold.
For I, Wisdom, am more precious than jewels;
nothing is as valuable for you as I am.
I, Wisdom, live with Common Sense; we are like two people living in the same house.
I know many things, and I act carefully.
Everyone who honors Yahweh hates what is evil.
I am Wisdom, and I hate it when people are proud, when they think they are more important than others.
I hate it when people act in evil ways, and when they tell lies.
I give good advice and I have the best wisdom;
I have true understanding about the nature of things, and I have great strength.
When kings are wise, they rule well;
and when rulers are wise, they make laws that are just.
By me princes rule, noblemen, and all who govern with justice.
I am Wisdom, and I love all who love me;
those who work hard to find me will find me.
These people will have lasting riches, and they will live right,
because I have riches and honor with me.
What I can give people is more valuable than fine gold and the best silver.
I always do what is right and just.
I give wealth to those who love me,
and I fill up their treasuries.
Yahweh created me, Wisdom; he made me when he began to create the world;
I was the first thing he created in the beginning.
He made me long ago—at the very first, at the beginning of the earth.
I was born before the oceans were created,
when there were no springs from which water flowed.
I was born before the hills and mountains were set in place.
I am Wisdom and I was born before Yahweh made the earth,
before he made the tiny particles of dust in the earth, I was there.
I was there when Yahweh put the heavens where they are,
on the day when he marked on the ocean's surface how far a person at sea can see in every direction.
I was there when Yahweh put the clouds above the earth,
and when he made the springs at the bottom of the sea to give water to the oceans.
I was there when he fixed a boundary for the seas,
so that the water in the seas would not go past those boundaries,
and when he marked out the limits of the dry land.
I was at Yahweh's side as his master craftsman;
I made him happy every day, and I always rejoiced when I was with him.
I was delighted with the whole world he created;
I was happy with the people he brought into existence, too.
So, you who are my children, listen to me.
How fortunate are those who live as I live.
Listen to what I teach you and you will become wise.
Do not reject what I have taught you.
How fortunate are those who listen to me,
those who wait for me outside my house every day.
Those who find me will find life,
and Yahweh will be pleased with them.
But those who do not find me, they hurt themselves.
All those who hate me love death."
Wisdom builds her own house, just like a woman who has built her home;
she made seven pillars to support the roof of her house.
She prepared a meal and set her table;
she prepared the animals and cooked them to serve for the dinner,
and she made the wine ready for her guests.
Like a woman who sends out her maids to give the invitations to her guests, Wisdom calls out from the highest place in the city for all to hear, and she says:
"If you are still immature, come here,"
and she gives the invitation to those who have no good judgment.
"Come and eat the food that I have prepared," she says,
"and drink the good wine that I have mixed.
Leave your untrained ways behind you, and live,
and I will show you how to walk on the road that will give you understanding.
If you rebuke someone who says insulting things about other people, he will insult you, too.
If you offer correction to an evil person, he will hurt you.
A person who insults others will hate you if you tell him to stop.
But if you rebuke a wise person, he will become your friend.
If you give instruction to a wise person, he will become even more wise.
And if you teach a person who does what is right, he will learn even more.
The first step in getting wisdom is to give Yahweh the respect he deserves,
and knowing Yahweh, the Holy One, is the where understanding comes from.
If you become wise, your days will be filled full,
and you will add years to your life.
If you become wise, you will gain many benefits from it;
if you ridicule other people, you will suffer by yourself."
A foolish woman talks loudly;
she is untaught in the subjects of wisdom and she knows very little.
She sits at the door of her house
or on the highest place in the town,
and she calls out to the men who are passing by,
to those walking down the road, concerned only about where they are going.
"Any of you who have no experience, come here,"
she says to those who have no good judgment.
"If you sleep with me, it will as sweet as drinking water that you have stolen,
or eating delicious food all by yourself."
Any man who accepts her invitation does not know that the dead are in her home,
that those who accepted her invitation and went into her house are now in the world of the dead.
These are the proverbs of Solomon:
A child who lives according to wisdom makes his father happy;
but if a child does foolish things, he causes his mother to be very sad.
Riches that you got by being dishonest will not have any value;
but when you do what is right, you will be protected from death.
Yahweh does not allow people who do right to starve,
but he will makes it impossible for wicked people to get what they want.
A lazy person who will not work becomes poor;
those who work hard become rich.
He is wise who harvests the crops when they are ready to be gathered;
but it would be shameful for him to sleep while others are harvesting the crop.
Those who do right will receive many good gifts from God;
but those who do wicked things cover their violence so they cannot be seen.
When we remember those who do what is right, we get a blessing from Yahweh;
but we cannot remember the names of the wicked.
Wise people follow good instructions,
but a fool who talks too much will fail.
An honest person lives his life and has nothing to hide;
but one who is dishonest—his lies will be discovered.
The one who winks his eye signals others to help him do something that is wrong,
and a fool will be ruined because he talks too much.
A person who does right is like a spring that gives life-saving water;
but the wicked person hides his brutality by his words.
Hatred has the power to start many arguments;
but love covers anything that may hurt us.
Those who have good sense say what is wise,
but people who do not have good judgment must be punished.
Wise people continue to learn all that they can,
but when foolish people speak, they will soon experience destruction.
The wealth that rich people have protects them like a city is protected by a strong wall around it ,
but because people are poor, they have no one to help them.
If you do what is right, your reward will lead you to life,
but all that sinful people gain is the ability to sin even more.
Life can be found by the one who is trained by discipline;
but the one who will not listen to correction wanders away.
Those who hide their hatred of others, must lie to cover it up.
and those who repeat slander are foolish.
When people talk a lot, sin is sure to follow;
if you are wise, you will always be careful about what you say.
The one who does right
is like pure silver;
there is little value in the heart of the one who does wicked things.
What those who do right say benefits many,
but foolish people die because they lack good sense.
Yahweh gives good gifts that make some people wealthy,
and he does not make them suffer for it.
Foolish people play games when they do what is wrong,
but people with understanding enjoy wisdom.
What the wicked fear will happen to them;
those who do what is right will get what they hoped for.
Wicked people are like the storm that comes and then it is gone.
but those who do right are like a foundation that lasts forever.
Like vinegar in our mouths or smoke in our eyes,
that is what the lazy man is like to the one who hired him.
If you give Yahweh the respect he deserves, you will live for a long time;
but wicked people die before they become old.
Those who do right have hope in their joy,
but the wicked can expect their lives to be short.
Following Yahweh brings protection to those who keep their promises;
but those who do not follow him find out he destroys those who do what is evil.
Those who do right will never be defeated,
but wicked people will not have a home.
Wisdom is like a fruit that those who do right bear,
but Yahweh will cut out the deceitful tongue.
Those who do right know the words Yahweh permits them to speak,
but wicked people say what Yahweh has forbidden.
When people use scales that are not correct;
Yahweh is angry that they are stealing from their customers;
he is delighted with those who use correct weights on the scales.
People who are proud live in such a way that always ends in disgrace;
people who are humble are the only ones who can learn about wisdom.
People who keep their promises also make choices that lead them in the right way;
those who cannot be trusted are destroyed by their own dishonesty.
Your money will not help you on the day Yahweh judges the world;
but if you do what is right, you will be kept safe from many dangers, even death.
When people are honest and good, they know where they should go and what they should do;
but those who do evil find that their wickedness will destroy them.
God rescues those who do what is right,
but those who do what is evil become slaves to their desires.
When a wicked person dies, all he hoped for in the future is lost;
what he wanted to accomplish with his strength, will never happen.
The one who does what is right, Yahweh delivers from trouble;
and Yahweh gives that trouble to the wicked.
A person who has no kind of religious faith uses his words to destroy his neighbor;
but people who do right will be saved by the knowledge they have gathered.
When things go well for those who do what is right, those in their city are happy,
and shouts of joy are heard when wicked people die.
When there are people in the city who please God and they give good gifts to others, the city becomes great;
but the words spoken by the wicked tear down the city.
The one who treats his friend with contempt has no good judgment;
a person who has learned what is important says nothing.
Those who spread gossip tell secrets to others,
but a person you can trust will not talk about it.
A nation will be destroyed if it does not have leaders who guide it wisely;
but the nation will have victory when it listens to many advisors.
If you promise to pay off a loan that is taken by a stranger, you will lose your money.
You will be safe if you refuse to make any kind of agreement to pay someone else's debts.
A kindhearted woman earns respect;
but violent people take hold of riches.
By their kindness to others kind people give good gifts to themselves,
but one who is cruel hurts himself by his cruelty.
Wicked people tell lies to make more money,
but those who do what is right will be paid even more because they earned it.
Those who do what is right will live,
but those who do what is wrong will die.
Yahweh hates those who take good things and they twist them and they do bad things with them,
but he is delighted with those who always do what is right.
It is certain that evil people will not escape their punishment.
and the children of those who do right will be kept safe.
If you see a gold ring in a pig's nose,
that is very much like a beautiful woman who does not have good sense.
Those who do what is right desire things that result in good,
but the reward of the wicked is that they will experience Yahweh's wrath.
If a person sows seed, he can expect to harvest a crop;
his few seeds will give him much more;
another person does not plant a crop, and he becomes poor.
Those who give generously to others will prosper;
if you share your water with other people, you will have enough for yourself, too.
People will curse the merchant who will not sell them grain,
but they praise the one who sells it.
If you work hard and go out to find what is good, you will also find good will.
but if you look for evil, you will find it.
Those who trust in their money will fall down,
but those who do what is right will grow like a healthy tree.
Those who bring troubles to their families will inherit nothing,
and those who do foolish things will become the servants of those who are wise.
Those who do what is right will be like a life giving tree,
but acts of violence take away life.
It is sure that those who do what is right will get what they truly deserve;
but even more, the person who does bad things
and the one who sins against Yahweh,
will surely receive what they deserve.
The one who wants to learn will welcome correction.
But the one who does not want to be corrected will remain stupid.
Yahweh approves of those who are good,
but he condemns those who make evil plans.
Wickedness is a bad foundation for a person's life.
People who do well are as stable as a tree with deep roots.
A good wife brings praise to her husband,
but a wife who brings shame home is like a disease that destroys his bones.
People who do the right thing make plans that are fair and just.
But advice given by wicked people are filled with lies.
What wicked people say is like setting up a secret attack while planning to commit murder;
but when those who please Yahweh speak, their words keep them out of danger.
Wicked people are put out of power, and they are gone,
but those who do what is right will have many generations and that family will continue for a long time.
A person will be praised according to how much widsom he has;
but one who takes good things and twists them into bad will be hated.
It is better to be a humble person, just living your life as a servant to others,
than to tell others how important you are, but you have nothing to eat.
People who do what is right care about the feeding and health of their animals,
but even when the wicked try to do something for their animals, it becomes an act of cruelty.
The farmer who works hard in the fields will have enough food to eat,
but those who have no good judgment take on projects that bring them nothing.
Wicked people desire the things that evil people have—things they stole from others.
But people who do what is right have what they have earned; it is their reward.
An evil person is trapped by the wicked things he says,
but those who do right stay away from much trouble.
The good words spoken by a person fill his life with good things,
just as his hard work brings him a reward.
Foolish people think that what they are doing is always right;
but wise people are willing to listen to advice.
A foolish person quickly shows how angry he is;
but those who have good sense ignore it when someone insults them.
Speaking the truth is the same as saying what is right,
but a dishonest person tell lies.
When a person speaks without thinking, it is like they are taking stabs at you with a sword;
but what wise people say helps to heal the hurts.
Speaking the truth will never be out of favor,
but a lie is over in a moment.
When evil is planned there must be lies within those who carry it out;
but those who give advice that leads to peace, those advisors will celebrate.
Bad things do not happen to those who do what is right,
but wicked people's lives are filled up with troubles.
Yahweh detests those who tell lies,
but he is delighted with those who live faithfully.
Those with good sense do not reveal all that they know,
but foolish people shout out their foolish thinking.
Those who are known for their hard work will gain authority over others,
but those who are lazy will be forced to work, even though they hate it.
When a person is anxious, it is like he is carrying a heavy load,
but a good word makes him feel better.
The one who does right will be a good guide for his friend,
but wicked people always get lost.
Lazy people do not even cook the animal they caught,
but those who work hard will acquire wealth that is worth keeping.
Those who walk in the right way find life
and on that road there is no death.
A wise child pays attention to the teaching his father gives him;
but a stubborn child refuses to listen to correction.
Good things come as the fruit of what one says,
but the desire of the deceitful is to consume more and more violence.
The person who is very careful about what he says preserves his life;
the one who talks too much ruins everything.
People who are lazy are hungry for everything, but they will not get anything.
People who work hard will get more than they desired.
Anyone who does right hates it when other tell lies,
but a wicked person brings disgrace on himself.
Anyone who does right always acts in ways that are respected,
but the one who does what Yahweh has forbidden ruins his own wicked life.
Some people have many possessions, but they have nothing of value;
but other people give all they have away, and yet have the best kind of riches.
A rich person may have to use his wealth to buy back his life from a criminal who holds him as a hostage,
but a poor person does not listen even when he is threatened.
The one who does what is right shines like a light that gives joy,
but wicked people are like a lamp that will be extinguished.
Pride works within a person and it results in conflict and arguments,
but those who listen to good advice find the wisdom they need.
People who think too much of themselves will spend all their money;
the one who makes his money by working with his hands will find ways to make his money grow.
When hope for the future is postponed, it makes you sick—you feel you will never receive what you long for,
but if you receive what you desire, that will be like a tree that gives life.
Those who despise good advice bring the punishment for disobeying upon themselves;
the one who pays attention to the instruction will receive honor.
The lesson taught by the wise is like a fountain that gives life to all who drink from it,
and they inform you about all the deadly dangers around you.
Having a mind that understands right and wrong brings you respect,
but the one who twists good gifts for bad purposes—he never reaches his destination.
Those who have good sense always take action from what they know is true;
a foolish person proves his decisions are folly, and everyone sees it.
A wicked messenger will not deliver the message,
but bitter enemies are brought together
when the messages are delivered by a dependable messenger.
The one who does not learn from the lessons of discipline will be poor, and he will know shame,
but the one who takes the lessons of discipline and learns from them,
honor will find him.
When a longing comes true,
it is sweet delight to the one with desires;
and those who are foolish continue to turn toward evil again and again.
If you spend time with wise people,
by their lives they will show you how you can be wise, as well.
Sinners run away and disasters chase after them,
but those who do what is right find the good is their reward.
A good person sets apart money to give his grandchildren when he dies,
but a sinful person will store up his wealth, not knowing that it will be given to the one who does right.
A field owned by a poor person can produce much food,
but the poor are victims of injustice more than the rich,
and the crop is not planted.
A parent who does not train his child in how he should live does not show him any love,
but the one who is careful to train the child in how he should live shows his great love.
Those who do what is right eat enough food to satisfy their hunger,
but the wicked complain that they are always hungry.
A wise woman holds her family together,
but a foolish woman tears it apart by the foolish things she does.
The one who honors Yahweh in the way he lives, gives to Yahweh the respect he deserves;
the dishonest person shows his disrespect, and he despises Yahweh.
Pride grows out of the mouth of the fool, like an offshoot from a tree;
but what wise people say preserves their lives.
Where there are no cattle feeding in the barn, the feeding trough is clean;
but if a farmer only has one ox, still he can grow a very great crop.
You can tell if a witness is reliable, if he tells the truth,
but when a witness breaths out lie after lie, he is a false witness and cannot be depended on.
One who thinks he is better than others, he may seek wisdom, but he will not find it,
but the one who has grown in knowledge can easily learn much more.
Do not stay close to a foolish person: Walk away from him.
There is no knowledge to be learned from him.
The one who has learned much knowledge applies it to his own life; that is wisdom.
The foundation of all folly is the lie.
Fools watch the guilt offering being sacrificed in the temple, and they make fun of it,
but those who please Yahweh are glad to share his favor.
A person keeps close inside all his bitterness and disappointment;
and no stranger will ever know all the joy it contains.
The family of the wicked will be destroyed,
but a little tent where the upright live will grow, like a tree grows into something grand.
A person sees a way, and it appears to be the right way for him to go,
but he does not know that it only leads to death.
A person can be in great pain and still be able to laugh;
a time of great joy may end in grief.
The faithless man will receive from Yahweh what he deserves;
but Yahweh will give a good person what is his.
Those who have had no instruction believe everything they are told,
but the man who has learned some knowledge thinks about what he will do.
A wise person sees evil and is afraid of it, and he turns away from it;
the foolish person boldly throws aside every warning.
Those who get angry quickly do foolish things;
people hate those who make evil plans.
Those who have not been instructed have foolishness handed to them;
those who have learned a little knowledge are surrounded by it.
Evil people will bow down before those who are good,
and the wicked people will bow down at the gates of those who do right.
The poor are hated even by their own companions,
but the rich have many friends.
It is sinful to have contempt for your neighbors;
but how fortunate are those who do kind things for the poor.
Those who plot with evil plans, do they not go astray?
But those who make plans for the good will receive love and faithfulness.
If you work hard, you will make some money,
but where there is only talk, it leads to poverty.
The reward of the wise is the wealth they have,
but the folly of fools only brings them more foolishness.
A witness who tells the truth, saves the lives of the innocent;
a lying witness is filled with deceit.
Those give Yahweh the honor he deserves
have much confidence in him;
giving honor to Yahweh will also protect your children.
Giving Yahweh the honor he deserves is like having a fountain that gives life;
so you can keep away from being trapped by death.
A king measures his glory by the number of the people in his kingdom,
but if the prince has no people, he is brought to ruin.
Those who do not quickly become angry have much understanding;
the quick-tempered praise foolishness.
Being at peace is good for the whole body,
but having evil within, rots the bones.
The one who oppresses a poor person curses Yahweh who made him,
but those who show favor to a poor person honor Yahweh.
The wicked person is brought down by his evil actions,
but those who do what is right have a safe home, even in death.
Wisdom finds a place to rest in someone who has discernment,
but wisdom lets herself be known even among fools.
When a people do what is right, the nation does well,
but sin brings disgrace upon any people.
A king is pleased with a servant who does his work with good judgment,
but the king is angry with any servant who brings shame to him.
A gentle answer turns away anger,
but a harsh reply stirs up anger even more.
When wise people speak, they give praise to the value of knowledge;
foolish people continually say foolish things.
Yahweh sees everything that is happening;
he keeps account of the evil and of the good.
A person who can give healing with what they say is like a tree that gives life;
when someone lies to you, it can feel like they have crushed you.
A fool has contempt for his father when he disciplines him,
but the one who learns from correction has insight.
In the families of those who do right there are great treasures,
but the wealth that the wicked have gives them great troubles.
The wise scatter knowledge about like the farmer scatters his seed,
but the hearts of fools are not so generous.
Yahweh hates it when the wicked offer their sacrifices,
but when those who please him pray, he is delighted.
Yahweh hates the way the wicked live,
but he loves the one who runs after what is right.
Yahweh will discipline those who lose their way,
and those who hate correction will die.
The places of death and destruction are known to Yahweh;
how much more does Yahweh know everything within the minds of the people he has made?
The one who thinks he is better than anyone, he resents being corrected by anyone;
he thinks he is so smart, he will never talk with one who is wise.
When people are happy, they have smiles on their faces,
but sadness is so strong it crushes the person.
The longing of the one who is wise is to gain more knowledge,
but foolish people only say foolish things.
Every day for one who is oppressed is misery for him,
but those who have a happy heart, for them life is a never-ending party.
It is much better to have only a little and to give Yahweh the honor he deserves,
than to have great wealth along with much confusion.
It is better to have a simple meal with vegetables when there is love in the home,
than to enjoy a delicious meal served by people who hate you.
When a person is angry, he stirs up more arguments,
but one who does not quickly become angry, he is able to stop an argument and make peace.
The life of a lazy person is like someone trying to walk through a hedge of thorns,
but those who do what pleases Yahweh are like those who are walking on a level highway.
A wise child brings happiness to his father,
but it is a foolish person who despises his mother.
Foolish people enjoy their folly;
those who have insight live a good life.
When there is no one giving advice, plans go wrong,
but with many advisors, they will succeed.
People rejoice when they give a good answer,
and how nice is the right word spoken at the right moment.
The path leading to life goes up, away from death;
he follows that way and turns from the place of the dead.
Yahweh destroys the generations of proud people,
but he protects the little owned by a widow.
Yahweh hates what wicked people are thinking about,
but when people say what is kind, they are pure.
The thief brings many troubles to his family,
but the one who refuses to accept bribes will live.
The people who do right think carefully before they answer;
it is like the wicked pour out of their mouths all kinds of evil when they talk.
Yahweh is far away from wicked people,
but he listens to the prayers of those who do what is right.
When people smile, it makes them happy,
and good news brings healing to the body.
If you pay attention when someone corrects you,
you will stay among those who are wise.
The one who refuses to follow discipline, despises himself;
the one who receives correction gains understanding as well.
The honor that Yahweh deserves will be the lesson that will teach you wisdom,
and then humility comes before honor.
People make plans out of their longings deep within them,
but it is Yahweh who tells him what will happen.
A person sees nothing wrong with what he does,
but Yahweh measures every part of what a person does according to his purposes.
When you work, give all your ideas and your labor to Yahweh,
and your plans will be successful.
When Yahweh made everything, he made them so they would all accomplish something for him.
He has even made the wicked for the day when there is great trouble.
Yahweh hates those whose pride comes from deep within them.
But you can be sure of this: They will still be punished for their pride.
Love and faithfulness will cover over sin and forgive sin.
When people give Yahweh the respect he deserves,
they will be able to turn away from doing what is evil.
When a person pleases Yahweh by the way he lives his life,
he even causes that person's enemies to get along with him.
It is better to have a little money and to follow what is right,
than to have a large amount of money and to live by spreading injustice.
From deep within a person come the plans he makes,
but Yahweh leads the person in each step he takes.
A king can speak with inspired judgment;
and when he makes a ruling, it is good and true.
Honest scales come from Yahweh;
it is he who decided how much each unit should weigh.
We should hate it when kings do wicked things,
for the throne is set on a firm foundation when the king does what is right.
A king is happy when he hears someone speaking what is right;
and he loves the one who is direct when he talks.
If a king becomes angry, his wrath is a danger that can kill;
so wise people will try to calm him so that he is not too angry.
In a king's smile there is life;
when he is happy, he is like the cloud that brings the spring rain.
Becoming wise is better than having gold;
getting good understanding is better than having silver.
The one who lives in the way that is right will turn away from doing evil;
whoever is careful about how he lives his life
will preserve his life.
Pride happens to someone first, and then he perishes.
If someone thinks he is better than others,
he will have a terrible fall.
It is better to be humble and live among the poor
than to receive a portion of what proud people took by force.
Those who think about what they have been taught
find many good things in the lesson;
how fortunate are those who put their trust in Yahweh.
One who has wisdom deep inside him is given the title, "discerning,"
and those who speak in a way that can be understood
and can motivate their hearers, teach well.
When you understand, it is as if you have found a fountain of life within you;
but fools find their punishment when their foolishness comes back to them.
From deep within him, the wise person speaks from the insight he has learned;
and so when he speaks he has the power to pursuade others.
Kind words are like a honeycomb;
they are sweet for us to take in,
and they give healing to our bodies.
A person lives out his life and he thinks he is doing what is right,
but when he comes to the end of his life, all he finds is death.
A worker's appetite drives him to work harder,
his hunger urges him to keep working.
A worthless man digs and digs until he finds something
he can use to embarrass someone and cause them trouble;
and what he says about them is like a fire that burns the field.
A person who has no morals stirs up conflict between people;
and those who spread rumors pull friends apart.
A violent person tells lies to his friend,
and he leads him down a path that will never find what is good.
The one who winks the eye is signaling to others it is time to begin their terrible plot;
those who press their lips together, they do evil things.
Gray hair is like a glorious crown;
it is given to those who live their lives
by doing what is right.
The one who is slow to get angry is stronger than a warrior;
the one who is self-controlled is mightier than one who conquers a city by force.
The stones making up the "lot" are thrown into a person's lap,
but Yahweh decides on which side of the stones they will stop rolling.
It is better to eat a dry piece of bread and not have strife
than to live in a house where quarreling is as regular as feasting.
A slave who acts wisely will rule over the son of his master
if that son does shameful things.
That slave will receive a share of the inheritance and will be treated like one of his master's sons.
Silver is put into the crucible to be refined, and gold is put into the furnace to be made pure,
but it is Yahweh who makes people pure.
Those who do what is evil pay attention to the person who talks in wicked ways,
and those who tell lies listen to those who speak in order to make trouble.
The one who makes fun of those who are poor insults Yahweh who made him;
Yahweh will punish those who are happy when someone else has troubles.
Grandchildren bring honor and respect to the aged,
and parents bring honor to their children.
A fool is not able to give an eloquent speech;
even more is it wrong to lie to someone with a royal title.
A bribe works like magic for the one who is giving the bribe;
everything he tries to do by giving bribes succeeds.
You must learn not to be offended by the one you love,
but if you bring up something to your friend that hurt you, and you do it over and over,
that will pull the best of friends apart.
A rebuke to someone with understanding goes deeper into him
than trying to teach a fool by hitting him a hundred times with a stick.
An evil person is only interested in disobeying the rules;
he deserves a messenger who will be cruel to him.
You would be better off meeting a mother bear who had been robbed of her cubs
than to meet a fool who is being foolish.
If someone gives back evil for the good that was given to him,
evil will stay in his family.
Starting a quarrel is like pumping water and letting it run everywhere;
it is much better to walk away before it starts.
When a court sets the wicked free and condemns those who do what is right,
Yahweh hates both of these actions.
There is no benefit for a fool when he pays money to learn about wisdom;
no matter how much he tries, he will not be able to learn about wisdom.
A friend loves you all the time,
and when you are in trouble, there is no one better than a brother to help you.
One having no good judgment will make a contract he cannot pay,
and he will even may a promise to pay the money his neighbor owes.
The one who loves to have arguments, that person also loves the sin that lies behind the conflict;
one thing leads to another: The one who makes the threshold of his door too high, it is sure to make someone break the bones in his foot.
A person who is dishonest because of what is within him, he will never find what is good,
and the one who tells lies will fall into trouble.
The father who has a fool brings sadness into his life;
the father of a fool cannot live a happy life.
Being cheerful is like medicine that makes you feel better,
but when you are crushed by sadness, it is as if every bone within you could break with only a touch.
A wicked person accepts a bribe in such a way as no one could see him,
so the bribe would change the verdict in his favor.
The one who has begun to understand, he knows that he must also now go after wisdom.
However, the foolish person has bold plans and impossible dreams,
and he looks for them no matter how far away they may be.
A foolish child brings a father great sadness,
and regret to the mother who gave birth to him.
It cannot be good to punish someone who does what is right,
and if a good man with moral character is punished by the law, this can never be good.
The one who has learned knowledge, learned to speak well using few words,
and the one who has understanding, does not lose his temper.
When a fool keeps silent, some may think he is very wise;
when he keeps his mouth shut, even a fool looks intelligent.
The one who keeps himself away from other people will only live for his own desires,
and he never acts with good judgment.
A foolish person does not enjoy understanding anything;
he only wants to tell others what he thinks.
A wicked person comes, and with them comes the contempt they have for other people—
and then comes shame and disgrace following along.
The words a man speaks are like the deep waters of an ocean
or a fountain that flows with wisdom.
When the wicked are treated with special honor, it is not good,
and it is not good to refuse to give justice to those who do what is right.
A foolish person says things that start arguments;
he says things that make other people want to beat him with a stick.
A foolish person brings himself to ruin by the things he says;
his very words set a trap in which he will be caught.
When a person gossips, his words are as sweet to other people as candy is in their mouths,
and they love to listen to them.
The person who does a poor job when he is working
is a relative to the one who destroys everything.
The name of Yahweh is like a castle that can never be overrun;
those who do what is right run for safety into it, and in the fortress of his name, they are safe.
The wealthy person depends on his wealth as a city depends on its fortifications;
he thinks it protects him as well as a high wall.
When a person is about to be ruined, it is his proud heart that brings his destruction,
but before a person can gain great honor, he must first learn to become humble.
A person who gives you an answer before he listens to you—
there is nothing more foolish
and nothing that gives him more shame.
A person may survive a terrible sickness in his body,
but if he feels his inner self is crushed, how can he survive?
Intelligent people have a desire to get more and more knowledge,
and wise people will find someone to teach them even more knowledge.
If you take a gift to an important person, you will open the way to allow you to talk to him.
The first person to present his case before a judge seems right
until the other side comes and questions him.
When there are two strong people having a dispute,
casting lots can help to settle the dispute.
If you offend your brother, finding a way to have peace with him again
may be harder than waging a battle to win a city.
and having an argument is more difficult to overcome
than breaking down the bars of a castle.
The words a person speaks can bring satisfaction to himself,
like the food he eats satisfies his stomach.
People are able to kill others or keep them alive by means of what they say.
And there is danger for those who love the power of their speaking.
The one who finds a wife, finds something so good it is a gift to bless his life,
and it is Yahweh who gives him this wonderful gift.
A poor person desperately begs for mercy,
One person says that he has many friends, but his life is ruined by them;
but there is a friend who stands with us through everything,
and he is always close at our side, even closer than a brother.
Compare a poor person who keeps his promises,
with a fool who is full of lies.
And consider, having desire without knowledge
is like running so fast that you miss the path you want to take.
The folly of a fool destroys his life,
but he becomes furious with Yahweh for his troubles.
Those who are wealthy easily find many friends,
A person who lies in order to become a friend will be punished for taking advantage,
just as the one whose every word he speaks is a lie, he will not escape.
When a person is generous with their gifts, many people will ask for favors,
it seems that everyone is a friend of the one who gives many gifts.
All the brothers of one who is poor hate him;
and even more do his friends hate him, and they go far away from him;
he calls out to them, but they have left.
The one who makes every effort to learn about wisdom, loves himself;
having understanding helps you know what is good and what is not.
The ones who lie when they give testimony will be punished,
but the one whose every word is a lie, he will die.
When a fool lives in luxury—it is not right,
and it is even worse for a slave to rule over princes.
A person with good sense is slow to get angry,
and it is to his honor that he overlooks it when someone does him wrong.
What is the wrath of the king like? It is like the roaring of a young lion,
but his kindness is like the dew on the grass.
A foolish child will ruin a father.
A wife who is always quarreling will upset her husband like water that is constantly dripping.
We can inherit houses and money from our parents,
but a sensible wife is from Yahweh.
The one who is lazy finds that sleep comes easily to him,
but anyone who refuses to work will go hungry.
The one who follows the command he was taught puts a guard over his life,
but the one who does not think about how he lives his life will die.
One who is kind to the poor, it is as if he were lending to Yahweh;
and Yahweh will pay him for what he did.
Train your children and give them discipline while it is still possible to rescue them;
but do not allow them to offend you so much that you consider taking their lives.
A hot-tempered person will pay a price for his anger;
if you rescue him after he had has an outburst, you will have to do it again and again.
Pay attention to good guidance and let others teach you
so that you can become wise by the end of your life.
A person has many plans that come from within him,
but Yahweh has his own plans, and he will carry them out.
A person wants loyalty,
and a poor person is better than a liar.
Anyone who has respect for Yahweh will live a long life;
such a person who has this respect for Yahweh will be satisfied,
and will come to no harm.
The lazy person puts his hand in the dish;
he is not able to raise his hand up to his mouth to eat.
If you punish someone who mocks others,
an uninstructed person will learn how to be prudent.
If you correct someone who has understanding,
he will gain more knowledge.
Someone who steals from his father and alienates his mother
brings shame and disgrace to himself.
My son, if you will not listen to the teaching,
you will wander away from the words of knowledge.
A lying witness laughs at anyone who acts justly,
and wicked people act sinfully as easily as they eat food.
Yahweh is ready to punish those who make themselves out to be better than other people,
and he is ready to flog the backs of fools.
Wine makes you loud, and strong drink makes you foolish;
whoever lets alcohol lead them to where they get lost is not wise.
The king's wrath makes people as afraid as if they were facing a young lion roaring at them;
the person who makes a king angry is giving up his own life.
It is an honor to stay out of an argument,
but every fool is ready to join one.
The lazy person is not willing to plow his crops again in autumn,
and when it is harvest time, he looks, but there is nothing growing in his field.
The purposes within a person's life are like waters in a deep well,
but a person who has understanding is able to draw them out.
Many people proclaim that they can be trusted to do what they promise,
but it is very difficult to find one who can really be trusted.
The person who always does right—
how fortunate will be his children who follow after him.
A king who sits on his throne to act as a judge
can distinguish between all the kinds of evil before him just by looking at them.
No one can truthfully say, "I have kept my heart pure, and I am free from my sins."
Uneven weights, improperly marked, and unequal measures, that favor the one who is selling,
Yahweh hates both of them.
Also, even a youth is known by how what he does,
it is clear whether what he does is pure and respectable or not.
Ears that hear and eyes that see—
Yahweh made them both.
If you love to sleep all the time, you will become poor;
stay awake when you should be at work and you will have plenty to eat.
"It is no good," the buyer says when he is bargaining with you about the price.
But after he buys it, he goes and boasts to his friends what a good price he bought it for.
Consider the value of gold and many expensive jewels,
but the words of the one who has knowledge are like precious jewels.
Take the expensive coat of the person who guarantees a loan for a stranger, so it can be sold if the debt is not paid back.
And if he makes a pledge for an immoral woman, hold his coat as a guarantee for the loan he makes.
Bread gotten by telling a lie, may taste sweet,
but later his mouth will be like it was full of gravel, because of his lies.
Good plans are made in consultation with good advisors,
and only with wise advisors giving their advice should anyone go to war.
A gossip tells secrets,
so stay away from people who talk too much.
If a person curses his father or his mother,
his life will be put out as a light that is snuffed out.
An inheritance that comes to a person quickly, may do some good at the beginning,
but later it will do less good for the person who received it.
Do not say, "I will pay you back for the wrong you did to me."
Wait for Yahweh and he will take care of the matter.
Yahweh detests those who use dishonest scales
and weights that are not accurate.
Yahweh is the one who directs the way a person will go.
So then, how can someone understand where he is going?
It is dangerous to declare that something is holy to Yahweh,
and it is worse to think about the meaning of holiness only after you have made a vow.
A king who is wise will separate the wicked from among his people;
then he will severely punish those wicked people.
The life-giving spirit within a man is the light shining from Yahweh within us,
it shines deep within and shows what is hidden deep inside us.
Love and faithfulness preserve the life of the king;
his throne is made strong by steadfast love.
The honor of young people is seen in how strong they are,
but the splendor of old people is in their gray hair.
When we are beaten, the wound that results may cleanse away evil,
and beatings make our inmost self clean.
The motives of the king are directed like a stream of water by Yahweh;
he diverts the king like he directs the flow of water, in any way he wants.
When a person looks at his own life, everything he does may seem right to him,
but what matters is what Yahweh thinks about what he does.
Doing what is right and just is more acceptable to Yahweh
than offering sacrifices to him.
When you show people that you think you are better than they,
and add to that the pride you have within you—this shines like a light and it tells others you are a wicked person—
they are examples of sin.
Those who work hard and who carry out their plans will be successful,
but everyone who takes action too quickly and with little planning, make themselves poor.
When someone becomes rich because he tells lies,
that wealth fades away like the mist; that wealth will kill him.
When wicked people act with violence, they are destroyed by their own violence,
because they refuse to do what is right.
A guilty person follows a path covered with lies,
but the innocent chooses to do what is right.
It is better to live alone in the corner of a housetop
than inside a house with a wife who always wants to argue with you.
The wicked man craves evil more than anything;
and when he looks at his neighbor,
the wicked man's eyes reveal
that he is not going to be kind to his neighbor.
When a person who acts like he is better than other people is punished,
the simple—who do not know about right and wrong—are taught an important lesson,
and if you teach one who is wise, they can learn even more.
One who does what is right watches the house where evil people live,
and he confronts their wickedness and brings them to justice.
When the poor cried out for help, there was a person who refused to listen to their cries,
but when he cried out, because he covered his ears to their cries, no one heard his cries.
Give a gift to a person who is angry with you, and it may turn away his anger;
a secret gift may help a person who is angry at you to calm down.
When there is justice, those who love what is right are happy,
but when there is justice, it brings great fear to those who do what is evil.
A person who does not understand right and wrong, will get lost when he tries to make decisions,
he will only rest when he is dead.
Love pleasure and it will make you poor;
you cannot be rich and love to drink wine and eat expensive foods.
A person who does right is honored much more than a wicked man,
and a good man is worth far more than one who never keeps his promise.
It is better to live alone in a desert
than with a wife who is always stirring up conflicts and never stops complaining.
Those who are wise have very precious treasures and they live very well,
but foolish people waste all they have.
A person who does right and is kind,
lives a good life, makes wise decisions, and receives honor from others.
When a wise leader goes up against a city of mighty warriors,
he knows how to bring down the defenses of the city and he conquers it.
Be careful, if you could put a guard to watch over the words that come out of your mouth and tongue,
you would keep away from a lot of trouble.
The mocker thinks he is better than other people,
and his actions come from his pride and his arrogance.
The things that the lazy person chooses to do will kill him;
he refuses to work.
All day long he desires things—he could not desire for more things—
but whoever does right gives gifts to others, and he never holds back anything that is good.
When the wicked decide to give an offering to Yahweh, Yahweh hates it,
and Yahweh hates it even more when the wicked man comes to worship Yahweh in order to get something for himself.
Those who lie about other people, will die,
but the one who takes time to listen—when he says something, people will remember it.
The wicked man acts as if he were strong,
but an honest man has thought about what to do and is certain about it.
Can there be any wisdom, any understanding, or any advice, that is wiser than Yahweh?
The groomsman prepares the horse for the day of battle,
but the outcome of the battle, the winner or the loser, is determined by Yahweh.
Being a person who keeps his word is more important than having great riches,
and being a person who everyone respects for doing right, is better than having silver and gold.
People who are rich and people who are poor have at least one thing in common—
Yahweh made both of them.
One who has good sense takes cover when he sees trouble coming,
but those who have no experience or knowledge rush ahead into danger.
When a person is humble and gives Yahweh the respect he deserves,
these are his rewards: Riches, and honor, and life.
Where the perverse walk, their way is like a road covered with thorns, and there are traps in every step.
When you guard your own life from evil, you will stay away from all these dangers.
A child must be shown the way to live and the direction he should go,
and when he reaches old age, he will stay on that same path.
The fact is that the rich often have power over the poor,
and one who borrows money is almost like a slave to the one who lends him the money.
If you plant the seeds of wickedness, you can expect a crop of trouble,
and when you use a rod to discipline your child,
but you use it when you are furious, it will do no good.
The one who looks for people to help, Yahweh will give many good gifts,
because he considered it important to share his food with the poor.
If you throw out the conceited person, out will go all kinds of conflict with him.
No one will quarrel or insult anyone else when he is gone.
When a person loves to do something just because he wants to do what is good and right—
he is sincere, and his speech is filled with kindness
—the king will be his friend.
Yahweh gives protection to knowledge, to keep it safe,
just as surely as he makes the lying promises of the betrayer fail.
A lazy person calls out, "There is a lion in the street! If I go out, I will be killed!"
The words spoken by an adulteress will draw you in, and it will be as if you have fallen into a deep and dangerous pit!
All those who fall into that pit will be in trouble,
but what is worse, they will experience Yahweh's anger for what they have done.
Stupid and silly things are bound up within a child,
and they come out in foolishness;
but correcting a child with discipline drives the folly far away.
The one who makes his money by taking advantage of the poor,
or by giving more money to the wealthy,
Yahweh will bring him into poverty.
Now listen to what those who are wise have said;
give it all your attention and learn the knowledge you will need if you are to become wise.
It will be good for you to make them the guiding principles you live by,
and be able to repeat all of them to others.
The most important thing is for you to trust in Yahweh,
and so I am teaching them to you, yes, even to you.
I have written thirty of these sayings for you to learn;
sayings to give you advice and to teach you what you do not know.
These lessons show you what is true and they teach you with faithful lessons,
so you may give reliable and true answers to those who sent you.
Anyone can rob a poor person. Do not do it.
And do not hurt them who are begging at the city gate,
for Yahweh stands to defend them,
and he will take the life of those who stole from the poor.
Do not become a friend with one whose life is controlled by his anger,
and do not associate with a person who rages in his terrible wrath,
or you will learn to be like him,
and your anger will become like a trap, a trap that will take charge of your life.
Be careful that you do not shake hands and promise to pay for the debts of others,
and do not make or sign a pledge so another person can take out a loan.
For if you cannot pay it back,
they will surely come and take away everything from you, even your bed on which you sleep.
The ancient boundary stones show where the property lines are. Do not take them away or move them. Your ancestors put them there. Leave them alone.
One who learns a trade and is skillful at it will become a servant of kings.
Because of his achievements he will not serve mere ordinary people.
When you sit down to eat a meal with ruler of a country,
think carefully about what is in front of you.
It is said, "put a knife to your throat" if you think of eating a lot of food,
because it would be foolish to eat too much at such an important event.
Do not crave the special and expensive food the ruler enjoys;
the food will deceive you.
Do not work so much that you are always tired, so you can become rich;
be wise and know when you should stop and rest.
As soon as you look at the money, it will be gone;
it will be as if it suddenly took up wings
and flew up like an eagle, up into the sky.
Do not eat with an evil man—he will gaze at your food for a long time—
do not desire his fine food,
because he will be thinking about how much your food cost him,
and he will say to you, "Eat and drink,"
but that is not what he will really be thinking.
When you realize what he is really thinking, you will want to vomit what you have eaten;
